examples.title: Close a restaurant and cancel all reservations on a given day
body: /* This example requires the following elements:
export const getRestaurantDetails = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (reservationLocationId, options) => {
export const updateRestaurantDetails = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (reservationLocationId, reservationLocationObject) => {
export const queryReservationsInDateRange = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (startDate, endDate) => {
// Set the earliest selectable date to the day after the current date
//Create an array to hold names and values for our dropdown list
//Use the _id stored in the reservation location's location object to get the location's name from the `locations` service
//Populate our dropdown list with the array
//Create a new special hour period to push to the list in our reservation location's business schedule
//Create a variable to hold of names and phone numbers of canceled reservations.
//Query for reservations on the selected date and cancel any at our selected reservation location

extra.description: This scenario sets up an interface that allows a site owner to select a reservation location and a date, and then close the restaurant on that date. We start by creating a day-long special hour period during which reservations can't be made. We then cancel all reservations on that date.

examples.title: Create a held reservation with a given time, location, and party size.
body: /* This example requires the following elements:
//Create an array to hold names and values for our locations dropdown list
//Use the _id stored in the reservation location's location object to get the location's name from the `locations` service
//Populate our dropdown list with the array
//Create an array to hold numbers and values for our party size dropdown list
//Populate our dropdown list with the array
//Get the list of time slots according to the details and options above
let fullListObject = await timeSlots.getTimeSlots(timeSlotDetails.reservationLocationId, timeSlotDetails.date, timeSlotDetails.partySize, timeSlotOptions);
//Create an array to hold numbers and values for our time slot dropdown list
//Populate our dropdown list with the array
//Get the list of time slots according to the details and options above

extra.description: This scenario sets up an interface that allows a site owner to select a reservation location and a party size, then select a time slot to reserve. Once a time slot is selected, the site owner can click a confirm button to create a held reservation at that time.

params.name: options
params.doc: An object representing the available options for querying reservation locations.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of reservation locations.
description: The `queryReservationLocations()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of reservation locations and returns a [`ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder`](#ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition, which is used to run the query using the [find()](#ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to filter, sort, and control the results that `queryReservationLocations()` returns.
`queryReservationLocations()` runs with the following `ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder` defaults, which you can override:
* [`skip(0)`](#ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder/skip)
* [`limit(50)`](#ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder/limit)
* [`descending('_createdDate')`](#ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder/descending)

The following `ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryReservationLocations()`. For a full description of the reservation location object, see the object returned for the [`items`](#ReservationLocationsQueryResult/items) property in [`ReservationLocationsQueryResult`](#ReservationLocationsQueryResult).
|PROPERTY	|SUPPORTED FILTERS & SORTING

|`_id`|[`eq()`](wix-table-reservations-v2.ReservationLocations.ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-table-reservations-v2.ReservationLocations.ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-table-reservations-v2.ReservationLocations.ReservationLocationsQueryBuilder#in)|

examples.title: Query all reservation locations (page code)
body: console.log('Success! Retrieved reservation locations from query:', retrievedReservationLocations);
*           "formatted": "Tel Aviv Port, Nemal Tel Aviv Street, Tel Aviv, Israel",

examples.title: Query all reservation locations with options (backend)
body: *           "formatted": "Tel Aviv Port, Nemal Tel Aviv Street, Tel Aviv, Israel",

extra.description: This example demonstrates how to request the `FULL` fieldset in `options` using elevation to get the necessary permissions.

docs.summary: Updates a reservation location. Supports partial updates.
description:
Each time the reservation location is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing revision must be included when updating the reservation location. This ensures you're working with the latest reservation location information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

You cannot use this endpoint to change a reservation location's `location` object. Attempting to do so will cause the server to return an application error.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: 2-letter country code in an [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: formatted
members.doc: Full address of the location.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic coordinates of the location.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address of the location. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

description: Address geolocation information.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The AppDefId

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: The instance Id

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: An application definition id (app_id in dev-center). For legacy reasons may be UUID or a string (from Java Enum).

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: An instance id. For legacy reasons may be UUID or a string.

members.name: state
members.doc: An application state.

description: Subscription was floating and assigned to site, features enabled on the target site

A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).
A boolean feature is similar to a quantitive feature with a default limit of 0 and UNLIMITED premium limit (although a bit simplified).

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc:
Time periods during which this location is open. Each period represents a range of hours during the week during which the location is
open.

Max: 100 time periods

description:
Time periods that this location is open for business. Includes a collection of TimePeriod instances.
Aligned with https://developers.google.com/my-business/reference/rest/v4/accounts.locations#businesshours
With a few minor adjustments
Cancellation was requested from the subscription manager api, might be a result of billing event, or direct call

members.name: created
members.doc: Reservation locations created.

members.name: myReservationsFields
members.doc:
"My reservations" field details.

These are the fields that appear in the "My reservations" section of the Table Reservations page on the restaurant's Wix site dashboard.

members.name: onlineReservations
members.doc: Settings for this location that are used to determine restaurant availability for reservations made online.

members.name: reservationForm
members.doc: Reservation form settings.

members.name: tableManagement
members.doc: Table management settings.

description: Subscription was upgraded or downgraded, as a result new features enabled, missing features disabled , quantities are updated

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Custom field ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Custom field name.

members.name: required
members.doc:
Whether the custom field is required.

Default: `false`

description: Custom field definition. Definitions of the fields that are added to the reservation form.

members.name: dateDeleted
members.doc: When the meta site was deleted.

members.name: deleteOrigin
members.doc: A reason (flow).

members.name: deleteStatus
members.doc: A status.

members.name: initiatorId
members.doc: A service that deleted it.

members.name: reservationLocationId
members.doc: Id of the ReservationLocation.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: checkedByDefault
members.doc:
Whether the checkbox is checked by default.

Default: `false`

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the checkbox is shown to the customer.

Default: `false`

description: Email marketing checkbox.

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
ID of the feature. __Note:__ Isn't unique. For example, all features that
are available to free Wix accounts or site in some capacity have
`{"id": "DEFAULT"}`. Use `uniqueName` as unique identifier for a feature.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `enabled` instead.

members.name: context
members.doc:
Information about whether the feature belongs to a Wix account or site.
Account features have `context.userId`. Site features have `context.metaSiteId` in case
they're assigned to a specific site. Site features that aren't assigned to
a specific site have neither ID.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Deprecated.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the customer is currently allowed to use the feature.
`true` means that the customer can use the feature. This means a boolean
feature is active or a quota feature has remaining usage.
`false` means that the customer can't use the feature.
This means a boolean feature isn't active or a quota feature doesn't
have remaining usage.

members.name: metadata
members.doc:
Metadata of the feature. Wix Premium uses the metadata object to indicate
that customers who purchase a product with the feature also get
access to an additional product. For these bundled products `metadata`
looks like this: `{"tpa": "{"appDefId": "sample-app-def-id-1234567890", "vendorProductId": "sample-productId"}}"`.
But you can use the `metadata` property for other purposes, too.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `quotaInfo` instead.

members.name: quotaInfo
members.doc:
Information about how often customers can use the feature during a specific
period. Available only for quota features.

members.name: subscriptionId
members.doc:
ID of the [subscription](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/subscription-object)
to which the feature instance belongs.

members.name: uniqueName
members.doc:
Unique name of the feature. Only lower case letters, numbers, and dashes
`-` are supported. Used in the endpoints of the
[Features Manager API](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/introduction)
to specify the feature. Not visible to customers. We recommend to start
the unique name with a prefix describing your organization or Wix company.
For example, `bookings` or `crm`.

Min: 2 characters
Max: 50 characters

members.name: updatedAt
members.doc: Deprecated.

members.name: cancelRequest
members.doc: Information about the feature cancellation.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: feature
members.doc: Canceled feature.

members.name: transferredToAccount
members.doc:
Information about a transfer to the account.
__Deprecated__. Use `reason.transferred_to_account` instead.

members.name: transferredToAnotherAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer to the account.

description: Feature was permanently cancelled

members.name: cancelRequest
members.doc: Information about the feature cancellation.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: transferredToAnotherAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer to the account.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc:
ID of the meta site that the feature instance is assigned to.
Only available for site level feature instances that are assigned to a Wix
site. Not available for account level and unassigned site level feature
instances.

members.name: userId
members.doc:
ID of the Wix account that the feature instance belongs to.
Available for both site and account level feature instances.

description:
Context this feature is currently connected to.
Note: Do not confuse with feature scope which is configured in the product catalog
and defines in which context the product can be used

members.name: feature
members.doc:
Disabled feature. Includes information about the feature's new state,
possibly its new context.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: ID of the meta site for which the feature has been disabled.

members.name: reassignedToAnotherSite
members.doc:
Information about a feature that's been reassigned to a different
site.

members.name: replacedByAnotherSubscription
members.doc:
Information about a feature that's been replaced by a feature from a
different subscription.

members.name: unassingedToFloating
members.doc: Information about a feature that's no longer assigned to a site.

description: Feature disabled and can be enabled in the future

members.name: reassignedToAnotherSite
members.doc:
Information about a feature that's been reassigned to a different
site.

members.name: replacedByAnotherSubscription
members.doc:
Information about a feature that's been replaced by a feature from a
different subscription.

members.name: unassingedToFloating
members.doc: Information about a feature that's no longer assigned to a site.

members.name: assignedFromFloating
members.doc: Information about a feature that hadn't been assigned to site.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: feature
members.doc: Enabled feature.

members.name: manualFeatureCreation
members.doc: Information about the manually created features.

members.name: migratedFromLegacy
members.doc: Information about a feature that was migrated from legacy.

members.name: newFeature
members.doc: Information about the new feature.

members.name: reassignedFromMetasite
members.doc:
Information about a transfer from another site.
__Deprecated__. Use `reason.reassigned_from_site` instead.

members.name: reassignedFromSite
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another site.

members.name: transferredFromAccount
members.doc:
Information about a transfer from another account.
__Deprecated__. Use `reason.transferred_from_another_account` instead.

members.name: transferredFromAnotherAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another account.

description: Feature created or enabled after disabled state

members.name: assignedFromFloating
members.doc: Information about a feature that hadn't been assigned to site.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: manualFeatureCreation
members.doc: Information about the manually created features.

members.name: migratedFromLegacy
members.doc: Information about a feature that was migrated from legacy.

members.name: newFeature
members.doc: Information about the new feature.

members.name: reassignedFromSite
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another site.

members.name: transferredFromAnotherAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another account.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc:
Information about an event that cancels a feature for the user.
Triggered for example, when a feature is canceled, transferred to
another account, or the user switched to a different contract.

members.name: disabled
members.doc:
Information about an event that disables a feature for the user.
Triggered for example, when a feature is unassigned from a site,
reassigned to a different site, or the user switched to a different contract.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Information about an event that makes a feature eligible to the user.
Triggered for example, for new features or when a feature is reassigned
to an account or a site.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
Timestamp of the event in
[UTC time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: updated
members.doc:
Information about an event that updates a feature. An `updated` event
is triggered for example by the
[Report Quota Usage](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/report-quota-usage)
and [Reset Usage Counter](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/reset-usage-counter)
endpoints.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc:
Information about an event that cancels a feature for the user.
Triggered for example, when a feature is canceled, transferred to
another account, or the user switched to a different contract.

members.name: disabled
members.doc:
Information about an event that disables a feature for the user.
Triggered for example, when a feature is unassigned from a site,
reassigned to a different site, or the user switched to a different contract.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Information about an event that makes a feature eligible to the user.
Triggered for example, for new features or when a feature is reassigned
to an account or a site.

members.name: updated
members.doc:
Information about an event that updates a feature. An `updated` event
is triggered for example by the
[Report Quota Usage](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/report-quota-usage)
and [Reset Usage Counter](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/reset-usage-counter)
endpoints.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `enabled` instead.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `quotaInfo` instead.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: Information about a feature that doesn't have a usage quota.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: feature
members.doc:
Updated feature. Includes information about the feature's new state and
possibly its new context.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc: Information about a feature that has a usage quota.

description: Feature updated, for example Quota was increased due to upgrade

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: Information about a feature that doesn't have a usage quota.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc: Information about a feature that has a usage quota.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields to be returned.

- `PUBLIC`: Returns `id`, `archived`, `location`, `default`, `configuration.onlineReservations.partiesSize`, `configuration.onlineReservations.minimumReservationNotice`, `configuration.onlineReservations.businessSchedule`,
`configuration.onlineReservations.showPhoneNumber`, `configuration.onlineReservations.onlineReservationsEnabled`, `configuration.onlineReservations.manualApproval`, `configuration.reservationForm.submitMessage`,
`configuration.reservationForm.policiesEnabled`, `configuration.reservationForm.termsAndConditions`, `configuration.reservationForm.privacyPolicy`,
`configuration.reservationForm.customFieldDefinitions`, `configuration.reservationForm.lastNameRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailMarketingCheckbox`.
- `FULL`: Returns all fields.

Default: `PUBLIC`.

members.name: fieldsets

- `PUBLIC`: Returns `id`, `archived`, `location`, `default`, `configuration.onlineReservations.partiesSize`, `configuration.onlineReservations.minimumReservationNotice`, `configuration.onlineReservations.businessSchedule`,
`configuration.onlineReservations.showPhoneNumber`, `configuration.onlineReservations.onlineReservationsEnabled`, `configuration.onlineReservations.manualApproval`, `configuration.reservationForm.submitMessage`,
`configuration.reservationForm.policiesEnabled`, `configuration.reservationForm.termsAndConditions`, `configuration.reservationForm.privacyPolicy`,
`configuration.reservationForm.customFieldDefinitions`, `configuration.reservationForm.lastNameRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailMarketingCheckbox`.
- `FULL`: Returns all fields.

Default: `PUBLIC`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting for the locations list.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields to be returned.

- `PUBLIC`: Returns `id`, `archived`, `location`, `default`, `configuration.onlineReservations.partiesSize`, `configuration.onlineReservations.minimumReservationNotice`, `configuration.onlineReservations.businessSchedule`,
`configuration.onlineReservations.showPhoneNumber`, `configuration.onlineReservations.onlineReservationsEnabled`, `configuration.onlineReservations.manualApproval`, `configuration.reservationForm.submitMessage`,
`configuration.reservationForm.policiesEnabled`, `configuration.reservationForm.termsAndConditions`, `configuration.reservationForm.privacyPolicy`,
`configuration.reservationForm.customFieldDefinitions`, `configuration.reservationForm.lastNameRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailMarketingCheckbox`.
- `FULL`: Returns all fields.

Default: `PUBLIC`.

members.name: customFieldId
members.doc:
Custom field ID.

This should only be provided if the `fieldType` is `CUSTOM_FIELD`, in which case it is required and must match the ID of a custom field in the `customFieldDefinitions` array of the `reservationForm`.

members.name: fieldType
members.doc: Field type.

members.name: shown
members.doc: Whether the field is shown.

description: My reservations field definition.

members.name: newNamespace
members.doc: A new namespace.

members.name: oldNamespace
members.doc: A previous namespace.

description: New subscription created and features created as enabled

members.name: number
members.doc: The quantity of the chosen time unit.

members.name: unit
members.doc:
Time unit.

Supported values:
'UNKNOWN', 'MINUTES, 'HOURS', 'DAYS'.

description: Reservation notice period.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
The location's business schedule.

By default, the business schedule of a reservation location uses the values of its location's business schedule. However, after the first time a reservation location's business schedule has been modified, it stores and uses its own values and no longer mirrors its location's business schedule.
Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: defaultTurnoverTime
members.doc:
Default turnover time in minutes.

Turnover time is how much time a party is allotted for their entire reservation - from being seated to leaving the restaurant.

members.name: manualApproval
members.doc: Manual approval settings.

members.name: minimumReservationNotice
members.doc:
Minimum reservation notice.

The minimum amount of time that must be allowed between making a reservation and that reservation's start time.

members.name: onlineReservationsEnabled
members.doc: Whether online reservations are enabled.

members.name: partyPacing
members.doc:
Party pacing settings.

The maximum number of party reservations that can start within a 15-minute period.
For example, a party pacing of 5 would mean that no more than 5 parties could make a reservation for the period between `10:00.000`-`10:14.999`.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Party size limits for a reservation.

members.name: seatPacing
members.doc:
Seat pacing settings.

The maximum number of seats that can be filled by new reservations within a 15-minute period.
For example, setting a seat pacing of 15 would mean that between `10:00.000`-`10:14.999` there will be no more than 15 new seats available for reservation.

members.name: showPhoneNumber
members.doc: Whether a phone number is shown.

members.name: turnoverTimeRules
members.doc:
Custom turnover time rules.

This allows you to set different turnover times for different party sizes.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the page is on

members.name: pageId
members.doc: Invalidate by Page ID

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: max
members.doc: Maximum number of seats a party can reserve.

members.name: min
members.doc: Minimum number of seats a party can reserve.

description: The party size limits for a single reservation.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether this option is enabled.

members.name: number
members.doc: Maximum number of new party reservations that can be made every 15 minutes.

description:
Party pacing.
The maximum number of party reservations that can start within a 15-minute period.
For example, a party pacing of 5 would mean that no more than 5 parties could make a reservation for the period between `10:00.000`-`10:14.999`.

members.name: max
members.doc: Maximum number of seats a party can reserve.

members.name: min

description: The party size limits for a single reservation.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields to be returned.

- `PUBLIC`: Returns `id`, `archived`, `location`, `default`, `configuration.onlineReservations.partiesSize`, `configuration.onlineReservations.minimumReservationNotice`, `configuration.onlineReservations.businessSchedule`,
`configuration.onlineReservations.showPhoneNumber`, `configuration.onlineReservations.onlineReservationsEnabled`, `configuration.onlineReservations.manualApproval`, `configuration.reservationForm.submitMessage`,
`configuration.reservationForm.policiesEnabled`, `configuration.reservationForm.termsAndConditions`, `configuration.reservationForm.privacyPolicy`,
`configuration.reservationForm.customFieldDefinitions`, `configuration.reservationForm.lastNameRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailMarketingCheckbox`.
- `FULL`: Returns all fields.

Default: `PUBLIC`.

members.name: fieldsets

Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields to be returned.

- `PUBLIC`: Returns `id`, `archived`, `location`, `default`, `configuration.onlineReservations.partiesSize`, `configuration.onlineReservations.minimumReservationNotice`, `configuration.onlineReservations.businessSchedule`,
`configuration.onlineReservations.showPhoneNumber`, `configuration.onlineReservations.onlineReservationsEnabled`, `configuration.onlineReservations.manualApproval`, `configuration.reservationForm.submitMessage`,
`configuration.reservationForm.policiesEnabled`, `configuration.reservationForm.termsAndConditions`, `configuration.reservationForm.privacyPolicy`,
`configuration.reservationForm.customFieldDefinitions`, `configuration.reservationForm.lastNameRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailRequired`, `configuration.reservationForm.emailMarketingCheckbox`.
- `FULL`: Returns all fields.

Default: `PUBLIC`.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Metadata for the paginated results.

members.name: reservationLocations
members.doc: List of reservation locations

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Default (or Freemium) quota limitation. if left undefined the free feature has unlimited amount.

members.name: period
members.doc: Periodic time-frame to reset the usage counter. You may use NO_PERIOD if counter shouldn't be reset.

members.name: units
members.doc: Usage measurement units (seconds? MBs? unitless?). Usage reported will be counted in multiples of this basic unit.

description: A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.name: currentUsage
members.doc:
How often the customer has used the feature during the current
period.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
How often the customer is allowed to use the feature during the specified
period. `null` means that the customer has unlimited access to the feature.

members.name: period
members.doc:
Time frame for the usage limitation. `NO_PERIOD` means that `remainingUsage`
isn't automatically reset to the feature's `limit` after a specific period.
You may still manually call
[Reset Usage Counter](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/reset-usage-counter).

members.name: remainingUsage
members.doc:
How often the customer can still use the feature during the current
period. `null` means that the customer has unlimited access to the feature.

members.name: reassignedFromMetasite
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another site.

description: Subscription moved from one site to another in the same account, features enabled on the target site

members.name: reassignedToMetasite
members.doc: Information about a transfer to the site.

description: Subscription was assigned to another site, causing  features on the origin  site to be disabled.
Another subscription was assigned to the site, causing existing features on this site to be disabled

members.name: customFieldDefinitions
members.doc: Custom fields you wish to add to the registration form for the customer to fill in.

members.name: emailMarketingCheckbox
members.doc: Email marketing checkbox settings.

members.name: emailRequired
members.doc:
Whether an email is required in the reservation form.

Default: `false`

members.name: lastNameRequired
members.doc:
Whether a last_name is required in the reservation form.

Default: `false`

members.name: policiesEnabled
members.doc: Whether to show policies (the terms and conditions, and the privacy policy) to the customer.

members.name: privacyPolicy
members.doc: Settings for displaying the privacy policy.

members.name: submitMessage
members.doc: A message shown to the customer in the registration form.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Settings for displaying the terms and conditions.

description: Reservation form settings.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: The date and time this reservation location was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Reservation location ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: The date and time this reservation location was last updated.

members.name: archived
members.doc: Whether this reservation location's `location` is archived.

members.name: configuration
members.doc: Reservation location configuration.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this reservation location's `location` is the default location of the business.

members.name: location
members.doc:
Physical location details.

Locations can be created and configured using the [Locations API](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/business-info/locations/introduction)
or on the [Business Info](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fsettings/business-info) page in the Dashboard.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of a reservation location. Each time the reservation location is modified, its `revision` changes. For an update operation to succeed, you must pass the latest revision.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether this option is enabled.

members.name: number
members.doc: Maximum number of seats that can be reserved every 15 minutes.

description:
Seat pacing.
The maximum number of seats that can be filled by new reservations within a 15-minute period.
For example, setting a seat pacing of 15 would mean that between `10:00.000`-`10:14.999` there will be no more than 15 new seats available for reservation.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: Either UUID or EmbeddedServiceType.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Not only UUID. Something here could be something weird.

members.name: originInstanceId
members.doc: An instance id from which this instance is originated.

members.name: version
members.doc: A version.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: Either UUID or EmbeddedServiceType.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Not only UUID. Something here could be something weird.

members.name: version
members.doc: A version.

members.name: context
members.doc: A context in which meta site was created.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: A namespace.

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

members.name: originTemplateId
members.doc: A template identifier (empty if not created from a template).

members.name: ownerId
members.doc: An account id of the owner.

members.name: siteName
members.doc: A meta site name (URL slug).

members.name: deleteContext
members.doc: A deletion context.

description: Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.

members.name: deleteContext
members.doc: A deletion context.

description: Hard deletion of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.

members.name: newSiteName
members.doc: A new meta site name (URL slug).

members.name: oldSiteName
members.doc: A previous meta site name (URL slug).

description: Rename of the site. Meaning, free public url has been changed as well.

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

description: Site transferred to another user.
Restoration of the meta site.

members.name: urls
members.doc: A list of URLs previously associated with the meta site.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order.

Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order. Defaults to `ASC`.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Additional details about the period.

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: isClosed
members.doc: Whether or not the location is closed during this period.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

description: Set of time periods when a location's operational hours differ from its normal business hours.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

description: Assigned Studio editor
Unassigned Studio editor

members.doc: Table combination ID.

members.name: isActive
members.doc: Whether the table combination is active (available to be reserved).

members.name: seatsMax
members.doc: Maximum number of seats that can be reserved in this table combination.

members.name: seatsMin
members.doc: Minimum number of seats that can be reserved in this table combination.

members.name: tableIds
members.doc: IDs of tables in the combination.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Table ID.

members.name: isActive
members.doc: Whether the table is active (available to be reserved).

members.name: name
members.doc: Table name.

members.name: seatsMax
members.doc: Maximum number of seats.

members.name: seatsMin
members.doc: Minimum number of seats.

members.name: deletedTableDefinitions
members.doc: Deleted table definitions.

members.name: tableCombinations
members.doc: Table combinations.

members.name: tableDefinitions
members.doc: Table definitions.

members.name: reservationLocationId
members.doc: ID of the affected reservation location.

members.name: tableIds
members.doc: IDs of deleted tables.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the terms and conditions are shown to the customer.

Default: `false`

members.name: text
members.doc: Terms and conditions text.

members.name: url
members.doc: Terms and conditions URL.

description: Terms and conditions.

members.name: text
members.doc: Terms and conditions text.

members.name: url
members.doc: Terms and conditions URL.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time this period ends in 24hr [ISO 8601](http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are `00:00-24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

This is the last time a reservation can be made at the restaurant, not the time the restaurant closes its doors.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time this period starts in 24hr [ISO 8601](http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are `00:00-24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

description:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: transferredFromAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another account.

description: Subscription transferred from another account, features on the current account were enabled.

members.name: transferredToAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer to the account.

description: Subscription was transferred to another account, features in the origin account were cancelled

members.name: maxSeats
members.doc: Maximum number of seats to qualify for this rule.

members.name: minSeats
members.doc: Minimum number of seats to qualify for this rule.

members.name: minutes
members.doc: Turnover time in minutes for qualifying parties.

description: Turnover rule. A turnover time is defined per party size range.

members.name: minutes
members.doc: Turnover time in minutes for qualifying parties.

members.name: seatsMax
members.doc: Maximum number of seats to qualify for this rule.

members.name: seatsMin
members.doc: Minimum number of seats to qualify for this rule.

description: Turnover time rule. A turnover time is defined per party size range.

Physical location details.

Locations can be created and configured using the [Locations API](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/business-info/locations/introduction)
or on the [Business Info](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fsettings/business-info) page in the Dashboard.
